subject: Mental Health
title: Electroconvulsive Therapy
description: A micro-lesson that makes Electroconvulsive Therapy usable.

hook.text: ECT has a terrifying reputation, mostly thanks to Hollywood horror scenes.

buildup.text: In reality, modern ECT uses brief electrical pulses under general anesthesia.

discovery.text: It's the most effective treatment for severe, treatment-resistant depression.

twist.text: About 80 percent of patients who failed all other treatments respond to ECT.

climax.text: The stigma around ECT prevents many from accessing a potentially life-saving option.

punchline.text: The most feared treatment may be the most effective.

quiz.question: What is ECT's success rate for treatment-resistant depression?
